page.title: 19General (1)
page.content: Lambeth is a typical Inner City Borough situated on the South Bank of the River Thames. Amongst the most famous features of the Borough is the Market in Brixton. The huge variety of fruit, fish, vegetables and meat reflects the equally rich racial composition of the community. The Irish are technically the largest Group, followed by Jamaican and then white British. Brixton is perhaps equally well known to outsiders for the two Uprisings in April 1981 and October '85, when local people expressed their anger at persistent racism on the part of local police. Physical scars of the street fighting are still visible in many parts of Brixton and Clapham and increased use of metal roller shutters on shops is evidence too.
